author: thhddnordr
title: Cardano NFT Art Festival
description: 采用Cardano存在着语言和文化上的差距。弥合文化和语言障碍的++最佳方式是通过++创造NFT艺术。

f6_assessments.q0: 虽然我认为问题陈述和解决方案与本提案的路线图内容不太一致，但拟议的项目解决了挑战，因为它将进一步发展一个正在进行的项目，向日本社区翻译和提供关于Catalyst和Cardano的信息。路线图更表明，该团队将提供关于NFT和Cardano的研讨会和积极的在线讨论，包括在项目路线图的最后设立一个艺术节。因此，基本上，这个挑战的大多数可能的方向将被解决：创建教育材料（在这种情况下是关于NFTs），让人们聚集在一起，翻译和教育。
f6_assessments.q1:
提案人提供了一个已经很活跃的网站，以及一个微博账号，可以查询外展项目的现状。因此，我认为该团队极有可能在获得额外资金的情况下为他们的项目投入更多的工作。
该团队希望增加几个以NFT为主题的教育项目，以及NFT艺术节。所提供的关于该团队的信息表明，他们已经有了活跃的追随者，这将是发展国家信托基金项目的目标受众。该提案没有表明该团队以前有举办国家信托基金的经验，也没有表明该团队在艺术/国家信托基金领域的关系如何，以及他们打算如何接触可能参加艺术节的艺术家。总的来说，这份提案在如何提供教育内容和讨论NFT的平台方面非常清楚，但提案没有提供任何关于他们计划如何建立一个艺术节的信息。因此，基本上，提案的范围在写作过程中发生了变化，主要集中在创建一个具有教育内容和研讨会的NFT主题网站--目的是建立一个艺术节。
如果能找到更多关于英语和日语社区之间的联系，那会很有趣，因为提案中提到了几次，"连接 "似乎是一个伟大的想法，不是创造孤立的空间，而是试图合并那些被语言分割的社区。我不太确定提案人是指正在运行的网站，还是他们打算创建一个新的网站。
f6_assessments.q2: 预算分解得有些宽泛，而且 "解决方案声明 "中提到了艺术节，应该为艺术节分配资金。到目前为止，资金只用于网站，包括网站的图形设计以及一些营销。如果像前面提到的那样与国内和国际艺术家合作，团队应该为这个艺术节提供一些目标，并且还必须细分预算，包括为他们想合作的艺术家。路线图和包括的目标是可行的和可审计的，并将通过discord和网站进行透明。

f6_assessments.q0: 在20世纪末，全球人口通过其电子产品品牌了解日本。在过去的几十年里，大多数人主要是通过日本动漫的视觉表现来了解其文化。我同意，NFT艺术节不仅有效地属于这一挑战，而且在更多方面是一个合适的活动。这个建议提供了一个机会，不仅可以导致进一步采用和更广泛地认识ADA，而且我们的CNFT社区可以从创造性的日本灵感的艺术作品中受益。
f6_assessments.q1: 两位主要提案人的资格非常详细，而且都与所提议的活动相一致。Yuki似乎是一个公认的翻译成日文的Cardano资源的提供者，提案中包括了目前已发表的成果的链接。Timothy似乎有组织这样一个活动的经验，并且是两种文化之间的主要桥梁。此外，他的网络似乎范围很大，他很可能成功地将Cardano的意识带给那些不属于我们加密世界的人。这只可能是有益的。这对夫妇一直在进行Telegram/Discord会议的事实已经增加了成功的可能性，因为他们肯定已经学会了如何运行这样一个事件。已经有了一个固定的听众，希望当它最终发生时，能有更大的规模。作为一个在前世为大学机构评估投标的人，我可以证明，提案人的资格、他们以前的经验和持续的Cardano承诺都是成功的秘诀。我同意，如果有机会的话，这个提议将被成功实施。
f6_assessments.q2: 提供了相当多的规划预测、成本计算和路径，以使该提案的可审计性。这两个提议者似乎是以兼职的方式处理他们与卡达诺有关的工作，这很可能是该项目部署一年的理由。然而，在3个月、6个月和12个月的时间里，有一些重要的里程碑，这将使 "项目催化剂 "能够评估其进展。这对该提案来说是个好兆头。我对这个提案没有什么可以进一步改进的建议，这也证明了它是多么的好。我唯一的建议是，一般的Cardano社区加入Telegram/Discord频道，即使你不是以日语为母语的人，因为你很可能获得对这个不断增长的社区的理解。你永远不知道，你很可能会从即将到来的CNFT中受益，提前了解。祝你好运。

f6_assessments.q0: 这个想法非常符合挑战所追求的目标，因为它打算创建一个网站，据我所知，它将鼓励在discord、telegram和zoom等平台上对NFT艺术进行辩论，目标是日本社区。作者还打算推广亲身参与的艺术节，但我相信只有在项目向前推进之后，也就是说，第一批投资已经完成，目标受众越来越大，并得到巩固。值得肯定的是，作者已经有将涉及Cardano生态系统的内容翻译成日文的大量工作，这表明他们对这项事业的参与。这也很重要，因为他们的社区已经有了不少人，这将使项目的执行更加简单，因为他们已经有了潜在的受众。我在这里想的是，我不明白为什么有必要创建一个网站来利用这种讨论；他们可以在他们已经提供的门户网站上推广。我想多了解一下这个网站的功能，它在内容上还会有什么？我相信作者用了很多篇幅来解释他们以前的活动和他们是谁，但他们没有解释这个项目的核心，也就是这个网站。他为什么会成为那个桥梁，他如何打破文化障碍等等。我希望在这方面有更多的细节。
f6_assessments.q1: 该提案最好的部分无疑是对作者的介绍。我们知道他们的名字和他们以前做过的几件事，他们与Cardano生态系统和日本的关系。关于这部分，没有什么可批评的。我们对作者成功执行项目的能力充满信心。关于脚本，他们没有建立阶段性的、适当详细的活动，我们这里有的只是成功的定义。通过这个主题，我们对每个季度会发生什么有了一个感性认识，但这还不足以让我们对项目本身的建设过程中会发生什么有一个坚实的了解。我建议作者对阶段进行划分（每个月是个好主意），并提到：将做什么，谁来做，做多少天，这样。我希望它是有用的，这个过程将被更好地理解。关于财务部门，我相信也会出现同样的问题。我们知道钱将如何分配，但这是以一种相当浅显的方式进行的，划分是非常宏观的。比如说。"3677美元用于网站设计和绘图"。这是一个不错的数额，这个设计将如何建立？除了网站界面，还将做什么？他们会聘请这方面的专业人士吗？在我看来，无论是在阶段性的建设还是在这个财务部门，都缺乏细节，所以在提案的这一部分进行审查是必要的。
f6_assessments.q2: 通过作者给出的成功定义，有可能行使良好的可审计性。我们可以成立一个小型的社区小组，与他们举行会议，向他们展示项目的进展情况，而反馈信息可以被带到社区的其他地方。如果被选来监督项目的人也是讲日语的人，那会很有趣。另一件重要的事情是，作者自己提供数据，说明网站的访问情况，他们的社区（在discord等）会有多大的发展，是否真的会有大量的人采用我们生态系统的技术（在这种情况下，使用NFT）。重要的是，他们用英语提供这种反馈，因为社区中的大多数人不会说日语。因此，我相信作者确实为未来的监测提供了相关的信息，社区本身参与监测网站的建设就足够了，他们自己带来了关于我们区块链的访问量和新用户数量的反馈，通过数字资产。我只是没有给最高分，因为没有这个 "桥梁"，但我们已经有了这些信息。

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree to the proposal, why 
 because the real problem needed to be solves has been identified and fallin within the scope of the challenge.

 the proposal has added a great value to the cardano ecosystem and key metrics and goals of the proposal has also fallin within the scope of the challenge.

the proposer has scale to address future challengies.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has provide evidence. reference, links and vidios with relevant skills and experience needed to implement this proposal if funded.

Th proposal has identifiably listed in manner the type and number of team memeber needde to implement the proposal and has rationally laid out the team structures and break downs.

 Budget has out lined clearly and break down into identifiable items reasonably to achieve the set goals of this proposal.

The proposal has a realistic time table and has provided a conductive plan for implementation and the plan describes the the resource needed to get the project to a success.
f6_assessments.q2:
Strongly agree because road maps and time horizons has been proven, and clearly denfined metrics with KPI's the defines to success of the proposal.

 understandable describtion of the targeted problem and understandable solutions to address it.

has a contency plans put in place for the chievement of the project

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal certainly fits the challenge description. There is a big language barrier between the English and Japanese communities. By making art the language between the Japanese and English communities you can close the communication gap. The only thing that is missing is a better explanation of your solution. It is missing a clear perspective.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer states that he has the relevant experience but gives no reference links to support this. Looking at the link provided in the proposal there are key documents in Japanese to help the Japanese community. 2 people are behind this proposal but we don't know if they need to hire extra team members to make this successful. Seeing the experience both members have they will probably need to hire members for the design of the website and development, but there is no mention of this. The budget breakdown also sents of a red flag for me in the sense that you have some random budget that adds up to exactly 10000 USD. A great proposal but there is not enough info to see this being successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided gives a clear view of what to expect from the proposal, but we are missing some metrics that go along with this. How many active users do you wish to have in 3/6/12 months? What KPI's do you have for the festival? How many artists do you plan on having at the festival?

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano NFT Art festival addresses the challenge connecting Japanese community using NFT art to bridge the language and culture gap to adopting Cardano. This will be done through annual NFT art event and it should be able to scale the impact in future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team is comprised of a Cardano Ambassador and an experienced event organiser. The budget is outlined clearly and reasonable enough to carry out the plan. It also explains how this will be done in the beginning as virtual event then turn to in person attendance.
f6_assessments.q2: The community can audit if the proposal has carried out the activities as mentioned in 3 months, 6 months and 12 months timeline as planned. The roadmap and milestones are straightforward and easy for the community to see through the successful implementation.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is in the challenge target because I think this implementation will be core to the Cardano community which will help any developer to get into the Cardano playing field and grow in the future. Create NFT art to overcome cultural and language barriers. In my opinion, this is a great idea and it perfectly meets this challenge.
Problems and solutions are clearly presented and easy to understand. Connect the Japanese/British community with the annual virtual Cardano NFT art festival in Japan featuring local/international artists. As far as I know Japan is a country that loves festivals, so this proposal will attract many people to learn about Cardano
f6_assessments.q1:
The need and the end goal are very clearly explained as the definition of success. The team has been working to engage the Japanese community by translating important articles, videos, documents....for their 1500+ members. In addition, there were also the participation of 4 interpreters: Japan Volunteer Support Conference and Cardano Japan Community Membership Discount Conference. The suggested solution is to create a website that focuses on making NFT and art the center of conversation in a forum, this is a great idea and I believe this suggestion will be appreciated high. solved because a team with community plus proven experience can complete this challenge
The proposed team of 2, although they did not lead a personal link so that we could track their experience as well as their work and education, the proposed group's qualifications were provided. and strongly support the proponents who have a lot of experience and capacity to carry out this project.
The minus point is that the proponent does not present any information about the potential risks and challenges that they may face while implementing the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmaps provide project plans that provide information on how goals will be achieved within certain time frames (3 months, 6 months, 12 months), if possible to be broken down to help community copper easier to audit
Proposal propose 1/5 of the budget of the whole challenge and list specific expenses, I think it makes perfect sense
I appreciate the feasibility of the proposal, but no specific KPIs or data are in place to help us measure what success will look like.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about organizing an Annual Cardano NFT Art Festival in Japan with local/international artists. This is an interesting idea. The problem is clearly described and explained in detail. The solution is clearly described with specific milestones.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Although this webpage [https://coinzzz.jp/] is only written in Japanese, however, with google translator, your team's works can be seen. Proposer and other team members' profiles should be described with links for verification. Because this proposal is related to organizing a Festival so ability as an event organizer is required. The KPIs.metrics were not provided. The budget structure remains very abstract, this should be explained in detail. Besides, the risk is not provided [organizing an event may face the risk of change of context condition, like: lockdown/pandemic, for example].
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, and give it a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
There is some lack of information: (1)Team profile; (2) Each team member's profile; (3) Budget explanations of calculation base for each item; (4) KPIs/ Metrics.
Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

f6_assessments.q0: I think it is effective. There are many ADA holders in Japan, but many of them have little involvement in the community. Therefore, it is necessary to hold an event to activate their involvement. And I think NFT is the most interesting theme. However, I don't think it is an issue that needs to be resolved immediately. In conclusion, I give a rating of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility is high. They have excellent team members and have good connections with the Japanese community. Also, they are also foreigners but have a good understanding of the situation in Japan. And they already have the resources to connect NFT artists to the Japanese community. In conclusion, I give a rating of 5.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is not sufficient. The roadmap and KPI settings are generally ambiguous. In particular, auditing is not easy because KPIs are not specified clearly. In conclusion, I give a rating of 2.

solution: 我们将在日本举办年度Cardano NFT艺术节，与当地/国际艺术家一起为日本/英语社区搭建桥梁。
experience:
8年日本会计/卡达诺大使/催化剂基金2提案人
11年 项目经理/8年 国防部活动协调员
